title: Chickpeas & Sweetcorn Stew
method: Prep: finely chop the sweetcorn and slice the wholewheat pasta.
Bring a shallow pan of seasoned liquid to a bare simmer.
Poach chickpeas 8–12 min until opaque and flaky.
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve chickpeas neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped parsley, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean Vietnamese presentation.
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal, more if training on the day.
swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Use tofu or chicken interchangeably to suit dietary preference.
Add chili to taste for more heat.

title: Carrots & Cottage Cheese Skewers
method: Prep: finely chop the carrots and slice the tomatoes.

Poach cottage cheese 8–12 min until opaque and flaky.
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.

swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.

title: Moroccan Cod Fillet with Courgette
method: Prep: finely chop the courgette and slice the farro.
Preheat to 190°C.
Toss cod fillet with oil, salt, pepper and spices; spread on a tray with veg.
Air-fry for 12–18 minutes until cod fillet is cooked through (75°C internal for poultry).
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve cod fillet neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped chives, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean Moroccan presentation.
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal, more if training on the day.
swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Use tofu or chicken interchangeably to suit dietary preference.
Add chili to taste for more heat.

method: Prep: finely chop the peppers and slice the spinach.
Preheat to 230°C.
Toss turkey breast with oil, salt, pepper and spices; spread on a tray with veg.
Broil for 15–21 minutes until turkey breast is cooked through (75°C internal for poultry).
Rest meat 3–5 min if applicable. Season to taste with lemon, herbs, and chili to preference.
Plate as suggested below and enjoy.
plating: Serve turkey breast neatly over grains with veg to one side; finish with chopped mint, a wedge of lemon, and a drizzle of olive oil for a clean Persian presentation.
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal, more if training on the day.
swaps: Swap grains for cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Use tofu or chicken interchangeably to suit dietary preference.
Add chili to taste for more heat.
